timeline.bodyText: +1 Nice! I see this as more useful for Bndtools than simply selecting the project.
timeline.author: gamerson

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand the expected behavior.  It seems the "link with editor" toggle button that is already in the toolbar does this behavior already.  I don't see this new PartListener you added as adding much value unless I'm missing something.
timeline.author: gamerson

replies.bodyText: No, it seems to not do this. I think what is happening is that the link tries to reveal the object, but if that object is not in the filtered list, it ignores the reveal. I.e. it only reveals objects that are allowed to be displayed. This listener resets the filter selection before the object is revealed.  It seems to follow the Link button. I.e. when it is off, the project is not shown in the list
replies.author: pkriens

replies.bodyText: That is the missing piece.  You need to have an active filter in place, and then open an editor that is in a project that is not currently being shown in the filtered list.
replies.author: gamerson

replies.bodyText: Actually, I just tried that, but I'm still not seeing your original problem.  Maybe we should jump on a call so I can see what you are seeing.
replies.author: gamerson

timeline.author: gamerson

replies.bodyText: I thought about this but this is a part that is being constructed. How can we construct a part when there is no activeWorkbenchWindow? I am assuming it is never null at that place?
replies.author: pkriens

replies.bodyText:
It is possible to have no active workbench window but it's not worth
considering IMHO :)
replies.author: gamerson

timeline.author: gamerson
gamerson

timeline.message:
[explorer] Selection reaction

- The 'open project' command now selects the bnd.bnd or build.bnd file if present
- The Bndtools explorer will show the project of the selected editor or the least project that had to be revealed. The reveal is used by the open project command.

Signed-off-by: Peter Kriens <Peter.Kriens@aqute.biz>

[explorer] Diverse changes

- Added a reload button, rebuilds workspace
- Use different icons, try to associate with JUnit bar
- Reorganized code a bit, hard to get Eclipse code to look good :-(
- Moved build listener to async update
- Added a 'prompt' bar with an expanded macro
- Prompt with Macro text in preferences
- When a macro is selected, the hover will show its expansion
- Restored the Syntax help on headers and instructions, not sure why that was gone, it wasn't really removed.



Signed-off-by: Peter Kriens <Peter.Kriens@aqute.biz>

[explorer] Diverse changes

- Added a reload button, rebuilds workspace
- Use different icons, try to associate with JUnit bar
- Reorganized code a bit, hard to get Eclipse code to look good :-(
- Moved build listener to async update
- Added a 'prompt' bar with an expanded macro
- Prompt with Macro text in preferences
- When a macro is selected, the hover will show its expansion
- Restored the Syntax help on headers and instructions, not sure why that was gone, it wasn't really removed.



Signed-off-by: Peter Kriens <Peter.Kriens@aqute.biz>

[bndtools explorer] Updates

- Reacts to changes in preferences
- Now has a separate model with update handling
- Uses closable pattern instead of hard coded dispose
- No more fields for controls, all local variables now
- Message Supports link to preferences when href=prefs
- Message Supports external links
- No expansion when preference is set to -
- Default message with link to preferences


Signed-off-by: Peter Kriens <Peter.Kriens@aqute.biz>
